title: How to Cook Oats Upma

steps.headline: Heat a nonstick pan.
steps.description: Place a large pan on the stove, and turn the heat to medium. Allow the pan to heat up for at least 3 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the oats and roast them until crisp.
steps.description: Once the pan is hot, place 1 cup (234 g) of instant oats inside. Stir the oats in the pan, and saute them until they become crisp, which should take approximately 4 to 5 minutes. Be sure to stir the oats constantly to keep them from burning.

steps.headline: Transfer the oats to a plate and set aside.
steps.description: When the oats are roasted, carefully place them on a plate or in a bowl. Set them aside for the moment to cool.

parts.name: Sauteing the Chana Dal and Urad Dal

steps.headline: Heat the oil.
steps.description: Add 1 ½ tablespoons (23 g) of canola oil to the empty but still hot pan that you used for the oats. Allow the oil to heat on the stove on medium for 1 to 2 minutes, or until it begins to shimmer. You can substitute ghee for the canola oil if you prefer.

steps.headline: Add the mustard seeds.
steps.description: When the oil is heated, mix ½ teaspoon (1 g) of mustard seeds into the pan. Allow the mustard seeds to heat until they begin to pop or crackle, which should only take about 30 seconds.

steps.headline: Mix in the chana dal and saute briefly.
steps.description: When the mustard seeds are heated, add ½ teaspoon (½ g) of chana dal to the pan. Stir it in well, and allow it to heat for about 5 seconds. Chana dal is also known as split bangal gram. It is a split kernel variety of chickpea that you can find at Indian grocery stores and many health food stores.

steps.headline: Stir in the urad dal and saute until the mixture is light brown.
steps.description: After you’ve cooked the chana dal into the recipe, add ½ teaspoon (½ g) of urad dal to the pan. Mix it in well, and allow the mixture to cook until both dals turn a light golden brown, which should take about a minute. Urad dal is also known as split, skinless black gram, and is variety of small black lentils. You can usually find it at Indian grocery stores and health food stores.

steps.headline: Add the cashews and saute them until browned.
steps.description: Once the chana dal and urad dal are lightly browned, mix 5 to 6 cashews into the pan. Allow them to cook for 1 to 2 minutes or until they are lightly browned. Adding the cashews is optional. If you don’t like them or have nut allergies, you can omit them.

steps.headline: Incorporate the green chilies, ginger paste, and curry leaves.
steps.description: After you’ve browned the cashews, add 2 small, finely chopped green chilies, 1 teaspoon (2 g) of ginger paste, and 7 to 8 curry leaves. Stir them in well, and allow the mixture to saute for a minute. You can find curry leaves at Indian grocery stores and many online retailers.

steps.headline: Mix in the onion and cook until tender.
steps.description: Add ⅓ cup (50 g) chopped onion to the pan, and stir them in well. Saute the onions until they are soft and translucent, which should take about 2 to 3 minutes.

steps.headline: Stir in the carrots and peas and season with salt.
steps.description: When the onions are tender, add ¼ cup (15 g) of finely chopped carrot and ¼ cup (40 g) of green peas. Mix in some some salt to taste as well. You can use either fresh or frozen peas.

steps.headline: Cover the pan and cook the mixture until the vegetables are tender.
steps.description: Once the carrots and peas are incorporated, place the lid on the pan. Allow the veggies to cook until they become soft, which should take 8 to 9 minutes. Don’t take the lid off the pan to stir the mixture while you’re waiting for the vegetables to soften.

steps.headline: Mix in the roasted oats and cook for a couple of minutes.
steps.description: When the vegetables are tender, add the oats that you roasted earlier to the pan. Stir them in to incorporate them well, and let the mixture cook for 2 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the water and cook the mixture until it’s absorbed.
steps.description: Pour 1 cup (237 ml) of water into the pan and mix it in well. Allow the mixture to cook for 3 to 5 minutes, or until the oats soak up all of the water.

steps.headline: Remove the oats from the heat and stir in the cilantro and lemon juice.
steps.description: Once the water is absorbed, take the pan off the stove. Add 1 tablespoon (3 g) of finely chopped cilantro and 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of lemon juice to the pan, and mix well until they’re fully incorporated. You can also add some grated coconut if you like.

steps.headline: Serve the oats while hot.
steps.description: When the oats mixture is fully seasoned, divide the oats between bowls. It’s best to eat the dish while it’s hot, so serve it right after it’s finished. Oats upma is often served with yogurt.

text: Roasting the Oats Heat a nonstick pan. Place a large pan on the stove, and turn the heat to medium. Allow the pan to heat up for at least 3 minutes. Add the oats and roast them until crisp. Once the pan is hot, place 1 cup (234 g) of instant oats inside. Stir the oats in the pan, and saute them until they become crisp, which should take approximately 4 to 5 minutes. Be sure to stir the oats constantly to keep them from burning. Transfer the oats to a plate and set aside. When the oats are roasted, carefully place them on a plate or in a bowl. Set them aside for the moment to cool. Sauteing the Chana Dal and Urad Dal Heat the oil. Add 1 ½ tablespoons (23 g) of canola oil to the empty but still hot pan that you used for the oats. Allow the oil to heat on the stove on medium for 1 to 2 minutes, or until it begins to shimmer. You can substitute ghee for the canola oil if you prefer. Add the mustard seeds. When the oil is heated, mix ½ teaspoon (1 g) of mustard seeds into the pan. Allow the mustard seeds to heat until they begin to pop or crackle, which should only take about 30 seconds. Mix in the chana dal and saute briefly. When the mustard seeds are heated, add ½ teaspoon (½ g) of chana dal to the pan. Stir it in well, and allow it to heat for about 5 seconds. Chana dal is also known as split bangal gram. It is a split kernel variety of chickpea that you can find at Indian grocery stores and many health food stores. Stir in the urad dal and saute until the mixture is light brown. After you’ve cooked the chana dal into the recipe, add ½ teaspoon (½ g) of urad dal to the pan. Mix it in well, and allow the mixture to cook until both dals turn a light golden brown, which should take about a minute. Urad dal is also known as split, skinless black gram, and is variety of small black lentils. You can usually find it at Indian grocery stores and health food stores. Cooking the Vegetables Add the cashews and saute them until browned. Once the chana dal and urad dal are lightly browned, mix 5 to 6 cashews into the pan. Allow them to cook for 1 to 2 minutes or until they are lightly browned. Adding the cashews is optional. If you don’t like them or have nut allergies, you can omit them. Incorporate the green chilies, ginger paste, and curry leaves. After you’ve browned the cashews, add 2 small, finely chopped green chilies, 1 teaspoon (2 g) of ginger paste, and 7 to 8 curry leaves. Stir them in well, and allow the mixture to saute for a minute. You can find curry leaves at Indian grocery stores and many online retailers. Mix in the onion and cook until tender. Add ⅓ cup (50 g) chopped onion to the pan, and stir them in well. Saute the onions until they are soft and translucent, which should take about 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in the carrots and peas and season with salt. When the onions are tender, add ¼ cup (15 g) of finely chopped carrot and ¼ cup (40 g) of green peas. Mix in some some salt to taste as well. You can use either fresh or frozen peas. Cover the pan and cook the mixture until the vegetables are tender. Once the carrots and peas are incorporated, place the lid on the pan. Allow the veggies to cook until they become soft, which should take 8 to 9 minutes. Don’t take the lid off the pan to stir the mixture while you’re waiting for the vegetables to soften. Finishing the Oats Mix in the roasted oats and cook for a couple of minutes. When the vegetables are tender, add the oats that you roasted earlier to the pan. Stir them in to incorporate them well, and let the mixture cook for 2 minutes. Add the water and cook the mixture until it’s absorbed. Pour 1 cup (237 ml) of water into the pan and mix it in well. Allow the mixture to cook for 3 to 5 minutes, or until the oats soak up all of the water. Remove the oats from the heat and stir in the cilantro and lemon juice. Once the water is absorbed, take the pan off the stove. Add 1 tablespoon (3 g) of finely chopped cilantro and 1 tablespoon (15 ml) of lemon juice to the pan, and mix well until they’re fully incorporated. You can also add some grated coconut if you like. Serve the oats while hot. When the oats mixture is fully seasoned, divide the oats between bowls. It’s best to eat the dish while it’s hot, so serve it right after it’s finished. Oats upma is often served with yogurt.
